question: What are you guys supposed to be... superheroes?
Really? Did you mother make those costumes? This is our territory. Beat it.
Why do they always fill stuff these things so full you can't pull 'em out without ripping 'em!
answer: I lost another fork tonight. She's getting suspicious, I know it.

question: So why don't you just tell her!
Why not?
answer: Because I can't! Okay? She wouldn't understand!

question: You're... new.
answer: You guys going to a costume party?

question: We're superheroes.
answer: Really? Like Captain Amazing? Are you famous?

question: Not yet.
We prefer to think of ourselves as unsung... I am the Blue Raja, Master of Silverware...
And Mister Furious... His anger is his power.
Usually a superpower is a magical endowment or a great skill. In his case, it's entirely emotional.
answer: So what can I get you?

question: Ask her out.
Roy, when was the last time you had an actual date?
answer: What does it matter? Women just want to control you--and talk about their feelings. They want to know why you're angry all the time--and what can they can do to help--so you tell them there's nothing--nothing--just leave me alone--but they bug you and they bug you and they bug you--until you just can't stand it anymore!--so you finally open up--you pop like a blister--and it all comes spewing out--all your emotions--your feelings--your fears--all of it! And then they dump you.

question: So you're chicken?
answer: Who's chicken? Doesn't it piss you off the way the when you really want to talk to somebody you can't think of anything to say!

question: Jeffrey!
What are you doing in the silver drawer?
It's on the television.
answer: Of course. I'm such a fool... Thanks, Mummy. Go to bed.

question: I hope you enjoy these cigars. I had to kill a dozen Cubans to get them.
Have you considered my offer?
answer: You know, Mr. F, me and the boys always loved workin' for you. You had such style But times have changed, and you been in that bug house a long tine. I can see you still got the style, but I dunno for sure you still got the edge.

question: I got it.
Good question.
answer: I knew you'd cone. I left that skylight open for you.

question: I know you did.
I know you knew I'd know.
answer: But did you know I knew you'd know I'd know?

question: Of course. I'd hate to waste a good bullet on a piece of scum like you, Tony. The jig is up, Casanova. I've spent six months watching you, and know exactly what you're up to.
I know that you're recruiting your old henchmen... I know who your girlfriend really is... And I know the terrible revenge that you plan to inflict on this city.
answer: I guess you know just about everything, don't you, Lance?

question: Um-hmm.
And what's that?
answer: That I've hot wired the city's entire power supply through that catwalk.

question: Everything's going exactly as we planned.
answer: Not quite. You haven't announced our engagement yet.

question: It must have slipped my mind.
Yes.
answer: So you're only invisible... to yourself?

question: No. If I look at myseif, I become visible.
answer: So you're only invisible, when abuolutely no one is looking at you?

question: Yes.
answer: So how do you know that you've ever been invisible?

question: I just know.
answer: Look, kid, we've got a lot of heroes to interview--

question: This is it. Come on in! I am the Blue Raja, Master of Silverware.
Would you mind filling out these forms; names, addresses, description of superpowers, that sort of thing.
Actually we lied about the babes, but there's plenty of burgers.
answer: That's false advertising!... We came all the way from South Champion, man! We coulda gone plinking!... We coulda gone bunqee jumping! Yeah!

question: I'm the Bowler.
answer: The Bowler? I remember him from when I was a kid. He was killed years ago.

question: I'm his daughter.
answer: Look, honey, being a superhero... it's a guy thing.

question: I'm her only son, and she always had such high hopes for me. Medicine. Law.
The cape. The turban. She wouldn't understand.
answer: I know... My girlfriends all dumped me after I put on the mask. They thought I'd lost it.

question: Anybody up for a little White Castle?
answer: Hi, cutie. Six losers. Six bullets. Perfect... Got any last words, Angry Boy?

question: Disco sucks.
answer: Disco sucks. Very good. You know what I'm gonna do, Angry Boy, since you're so colorful? I'm gonna save you for last. Sweet dreams, punk. Get him! What? LET'S GET OUTTA HERE!

question: I was eight.
Doctor Heller?
It's me... Elizabeth.
answer: Elizabeth! Little Elizabeth! Why you're so... middle aged!

question: Thanks.
He's dead.
answer: Oh that's right--they squished him... Heck of a guy.

question: Doc, these are my friends. We're superheroes, and we need your help.
answer: Well, I give to the United Way, and I feel that sort of covers--

question: But now Casanova's back! And we're gonna sit around here all night eating pizza and telling stories! Hey, lets toast some marshmellows!
answer: The wise snake coils before he strikes.

question: And a skunk stinks!
When are you going to take off that mask?
answer: When I am sure I am among friends.

question: Go dance with your mother, Jeffrey!
answer: Your rage is a very great power, but it blinds you to your heart.

question: My heart died a long time ago.
answer: It is not dead. It is hiding.

question: Monica... I was wondering if--uh-maybe we--I mean you and I--could-uh--you know--get a--I mean have a...
Yeah.
answer: I get off work in fifteen minutes. Walk me home?

question: Sure.
I admire you.
Being a superhero, wanting to save the world. It's so... unselfish.
Most people just want to make money or be famous or something. But you risk everything, just to help people.
Who wouldn't? I've never been able to figure out what to do with my life, which is why I guess I'm still a waitress.
answer: Nothing wrong with being a waitress.

question: What's your real name?
Have you always lived here? Me too... I love this stupid old town. It's noisy. It's smelly. It's falling apart.
Yeah. I've thought of leaving, going to Chicago or New York, but...
answer: What have they got that we ain't got?

question: Champion's going to bounce back, and I want to be here when it does.
You don't seem very angry right now. You know what? Underneath all that anger I think there's just a little boy who wants everyone to love him.
answer: I just want to be a superhero.

question: Going my way? Take it easy--take it easy. I just want to have a little chat... That was quite a number you did on my car. You've got a lot of violence in you... and I like that in a guy. You know what the difference is between good and evil, Roy? Evil is more fun. When you want something, you just take it, and if somebody gets in your way, you kill them... You seem like a very frustrated guy, Roy. Unhappy. Unfulfilled. What is it that you've always wanted, always desired? Because whatever it is, I can give it to you... Fame? Easy. Fortune? Even easier. Women? The easiest of all. I'll let you in on a little secret, Roy. In two days this entire city will belong to me, and there's not a damn thing your little pals can do about it. It's the perfect time to switch teams... So what do you say?
They always call the great ones nuts.
answer: And the nuts always call themselves great.

question: Are you with me... or against me?
Too bad. PLUG HIM! WAIT!
answer: Thanks for reminding me which team I'm on.

question: You're dead.
Excuse me. Monica... Beautiful name. It suits you. I hope you won't take this the wrong way, but I couldn't help but notice... that you're a dead ringer for Veronica Lake in "The Blue Dahlia".
Are you an actress?
You underestimate yourself. You know I'm writing a play--it's just a little Broadway thing, but thure's a part in it that I think you'd be perfect for.
I'd love to hear you read it. Could you stick around after the luncheon?
Jeffrey, YOU THIEF!
answer: Mother... it's not what you think!

question: And why are you wearing that silly costume?
answer: Because... I'M A SUPERHERO! Oh, Mother, I'm sorry. I know how much you wanted me to be a doctor or a lawyer with a family--but it's just not who I am!

question: But... the silverware?
answer: I use it... to fight evil.

question: Jeffrey... this is wonderful.
I always knew that you were special.
Ever since you were a little boy... Come with me. This is for you. Your Great Great Grandmother's wedding silver.
Hello?
Monica, where are you?
Are you nuts? Get out of there!
What are you talking about?
answer: Listen, Casanova may be a supervillain, but he's got a weakness, and I'm it. Maybe--just maybe--I can trick him into showing me the location of the whatchamathing.

question: He's a psycho! He'll kill you!
answer: Just shut up and listen. Hold off the attack as long as you can. If I can discover the location I'll call you--

question: And what if you get killed?
answer: Then at least I will have died trying, right? Roy... We might never see each other again, so I'd better tell you now... I think you're wonderful.

question: What?
Monica!
answer: Could you tell Mr. Frankenstein that Monica is here?

question: Hi.
answer: I thought you'd chickened out on me.

question: Just wanted to... powder my nose. How 'bout giving me "the tour"?
answer: Why not? Big, isn't it? Don't worry. It's not activated.

question: Who's the artist?
Come here.
answer: I'm not that kind of girl.

question: Then why are you here?
I'll be down in a jiffy.
You're a spy.
I saw him walk you home.
Roy. Don't be afraid... I never hit a lady...
Some girls just know how to die.
Darling, you've got the wrong idea.
